chapters.title: Definition
chapters.text: Diversification is the action of creating a investing portfolio with many different companies rather than just a single type of company that all share the same traits. This is a risk management strategy which means it is safer to have other assets to rely on if the market fluctuates negatively towards a type of market in a period of time

chapters.title: Relevance
chapters.text: Diversification is a great way to stay safe with your money when investing. Diversification is completely up to the buyer when it comes to investing in a stock. Creating an account to invest is free and there are many tips within those accounts to get you started on learning what different categories of companies to diversify in.

chapters.title: Example
chapters.text: Roger decides to invest $800 in stock for the year 2020. He is inclined to invest in apple as they are on a decline at $172.37 per stock during the COVID-19 pandemic. As Roger scans through the market, he finds Tesla is down to $620.23 per stock. Roger decides to invest his money in both and keep the remaining buying power for later. Having a dip in both companies rather than just one, Roger has secured a back up in case one stock underperforms more during the period of time he owns it.
